TextEquiv.Unicode: The mo Noble ELIXIR, For HYPOCHONDRIACK MELANCHOLY in MEN, and VAPOURS in WOMEN.

In Three Days Time demonrates to every one who takes it, that it is abſolutely eeual for the thorough Cure of thoſe perplexing Indiſpotions, even in their highe and mo grievous Degree, where nothing but Horror reigns, where Reaſoning is inter‑ rupted or depraved, and where the Mind is confuſed with terrible Perturbations, Anxieties, and Deſpondency even to Diraion.

It occaons no manner of Diſorder, is pleaſant to take, a few Drops of it are a Doſe, and is to be had only at Mr. Radford’s Toyſhop, at the Roſe and Crown again St. Clement’s Church yard in the Strand, at Five Shillings a Bottle with Direions.
The Royal BEAUTIFYING FLUID.

So exceedingly valued by the Ladies of Quality, and all who have uſed it, for its tranſcendent Excellency in beautifying the Face, Neck and Hands, to the mo exquite Perfeion poble, to be had only at Mr. RADFORD’S Toyſhop at the Roſe and Crown a gain St. Clement’s Church‑Yard in the Strand. It gives an in‑ expreble fine Air to the Features of the Face on the Spot, and furprizingly Handſomeneſs to the Neck and Hands, which it imme‑ diately makes exceeding ſmooth, fine and delicately white. No‑ thing in the World can ſuoner or more certainly take away all diſa‑ greeable Redneſs, Spots, Pimples, Heats, Roughneſs, Morphew, Worms in the Face, Marks of the Small‑pox, Sunburn or any other Diſcolouring, nor remove all Wrinkles ſo perfely; for it quickly makes the Skin become ſo incomparaply ne, clear, plnmp, ſoft, and beautifully fair as to cauſe Admiration in the Beholders. It really gives a mo engaging reſpleudent Brightneſs to the whole Countenance, and cauſes ſparkling Life, Spirit, and juvenile Bloom to reign in every Feature, and yet is nothing of Paint, but far ex‑ ceeds it, by its bringing the Skin, whether of the Face, Neck, or Hands, and tho’ brown, red or rough, to a natural youthful Fairneſs, Smouthneſs and mu charming Delicacy, which Paint only faintly imitates; neither is this Royal Beautifier prepared from the lea Particle of Mercury, or any Thing Metaline, but is perfely Harm leſs, and may be given inwardly to Children. It has alſo a pleaſant Scent, will not ſoil the fine Lawn, and is very agreeable to uſe. But these its admirable Properties, by which it valy exceeds any Thing whatever for the like Purpoſe, have occaon’d many to imi‑ tate it under various other Names, beware therefore of ſuch Impo‑ tions; the true ROYAL BEAUTIFYING FLUID, that has given ſuch univerſal Satisfaion to ſo many Ladies of Diſ‑ tinion, being only to be had at Mr. RADFORD’S Toyſhop above‑ mention’d at 3s. 6d. a Bottle; the Direions given with it are large and full.

At the ſaid RICHARD ROCK’S, may be had Daffey’s Elixir, 9d. a Bottle, the ſame as is ſold in other Places for 15d. A Tine‑ ture for the Tooth‑Ach, 1s. Balſamic Elixir for Coughs, 1s. And a Water which infallibly cures the Itch and all Cutanous Diſor‑ der., 1s. 6d. the Bottle. Proper Direions given with each Remedy.
Dr. R. NELSON.

Being well known to have made the CURE of SZMINAL and GENITAL IMREGILITIES his chief Study and Praice for above to Years, does recommend his mo Noble, Cleanfing, and Strengthning ELIXIR, which Thouſands of People (many of them of high Rank) have happily experi‑ �nced, and is by Numbers of Phyficians and Surgeons approved as the only BALSANICK, HEALING, and RESTORING Me‑ dicine, to be depended upon in the World,
For GLEETS and WEAKNESSES;

All Diſorders of the Urine, as Difficulty in the making, or retain‑ ing it, or its dribbling away hot or ſmarting, or foul, ſlimy, thready, greaſy, or inking, whether from Gravel, Stone, Strangury, or a Ve‑ nerial Cauſe, are likewiſe ſpeedily cured by it, and the Water made to be held as rongly, and yet brought away as freely, ealy, full‑ ream’d, and clear as ever.

Price Five Shillings a Bottle, ſold only (ſealed up with Direion‑ ct Mr. ISTED’s. a Bookſeller, at the Golden Ball, between St. Dunan’s Church and Chancery‑Lane End in Fleet‑reet, ask only for a Five Shilling Bottle of Elixir.
The only infallible and ſpeedy Cure for the mo confirm’d LEPROSY, eithor of the Moi, or Dry Kind,

By a pleaſant ELECTUARY, that has been ſold for ſeveral Years pa by the late Mr. Parry, in Boar’s‑head Court, Fleet‑ reet, with much, and happy Benefit to the Publick; and is now ſold only by Mr. Read for 5s. a Pot with Direions at his Houſe in White‑Fryars.
N. B. You turn in ju by the Sun Tavern in Fleet‑reet, and its the great Corner Houſe in White‑Fryars; James Read, in great Letters, is wrote over the Door.

For all Leprous, and other ubborn Breakings‑out on the Skin, whether of the whole Body, or in particular Parts only, this is the only ſure and eaſy Method of Cure, being an incomparable pleaſant Eleuary, which, after all the uſual Methods and Medicines, and even Salivations try’d in vain, perfely cradicates thoſe in ete‑ rate Maladies, tho’ of many Years anding, ſo as never to return a‑ gain; accompliſhing that in a few Days, which no other Means can pobly perform in many Months, and that with the greate Safety in the World, and without any Confinement, as has been happily ex‑ perienced by many Hundreds.

Common Itches and other ſlight Foulnefſes of the Skin, it com‑ pleatly cures almo in an Inant, without Trouble; and for the wor Scabbineſs, and mo grievous Leproſy, may certainly be de‑ pended upon as abſolutely infallible, as the Patients themſelves in Three Days Time will afſuredly find.
N. B. This noble ſpecifick Eleuary may be taken with equal Succeſs in extreme Weather, hot, or cold, by following the printed Direions given with the Medicine.
ANTI SYPHILICON
The only ſhort and mo infallible Cure in the Univerſe, for the VENEREAL DISEASE.

From the ſlighte Infeion, to the mo extreme and deplorable Degrees of it, even when the Blood and Juices are tho‑ toughly contaminated with its malignaut Virus, and the very Bones are affeed with it.

Fresh Infeions cald CLAPS, with all their attendant Symp‑ toms, tho’ ever ſo ſevere, are intirely carried off by it in a few Days, and ſo as effectually to prevent the Blood and Juices from being tain‑ ted with any remaining Relicks, on one Hand, or a ſeminal Gleer, or Weakneſs to happen on the other.

And the mo inveterate Degree of the French Illneſs, attended with nocturnal Pains, univerſal Breakings‑out, and all other the mo exaſperated Symptoms, are ſoon overcome by it, and effeually and much more ſafely cured than by Salivation, Inungation, or any other Method whatever, and in ſo eaſy and pleaſant a Manner, without impairing Strength, or occafioning any Inconveniencies, as loudly to beſpeak it the only oppofite Remedy, or true Venereal Antidote in the World; and this ſome Thouſands have, to their great Joy expe‑ rienced. It is pleaſant to take, occafions no Sickneſs or Diſorder, nor requires Confinement, but may be taken, and the Cure accompliſhed, without the Knowledge of the neare Friend.

Thoſe who ſuſpe they have received an Injury, may only by a Doſe or two of it be perfely freed from all Apprehenons; for it ſuffers no lurking Venom to lie hid in the Body, but wholly extir pates it Root and Branch, in a gentle, eaſy, and mo effeual Manner.

All ſuch likewiſe as doubt they have ſome remaining Relicks of former Injuries, may, by a few Doſes of it, intirely free them‑ ſelves from all Suſpicions of that Kind; for it admits of no Foulneſs, Corruption, or Putrefaion whatever, to remain in the Fluids; or to adhere to the Solids, and on that Account, in all Scorburick, Scrophulous, and even Leprous Eruptions or Foulneffes of the Skin, Glandulous Swellings and Impurities of the Juices, it does more by once Doſe than any other Medicine yet known can by ten.

The Price of this mo noble Anti‑Syphilicon is but Six Shilling� a Pot, which condering its extraordinary Efficacy, one Pot only be‑ ing ſufficient, in mo Caſes, to accompliſh the Cure, is not a tenth Part of its Value; and is appointed by the Author to be had only at Mr. Radfors Toy‑ſhop, at the Roſe and Crown again St. Cle‑ ment’s Church‑yard in the Strand, ready ſealed up, with a Book of Inruions, by the Peruſal of which all Perſons who were ever af‑ feed with any Degree of the Venereal Diſeaſe, may perfely un‑ derand their own Condition, and certainly know when, and when not, the Venereal Poiſon is entirely rooted out of their Bodies.
Note Ask only for a Six Shilling Pot for the Scurvy.
The famous, ineimable, PROLIFICK ELIXIR, The highe, riche, and mo powerful Cordial in Nature in recommended.

Being the only true and infallible Cure for BARRENNESS in WOMEN, and IMPOTENCY in MEN, in the Univerſe, and which it at once accompliſhes without the lea Trou‑ ble, even after all other Remedies have faid, as many Thouſands have experienced; and that by promoting the chearful Curricle of the Blood and Juices, raing all the Fluids from their languid de‑ preed State, to one more florid and ſparkling; opening all Ob‑ ruions, fortifying the Nerves, encreang the Animal Spirits, re‑ oring a juvenile Bloom, and evidently repleniſhing the criſpy Fibres of the whole Habit with a generous Warmth and balmy Moiure, and thereby invigorating it to ſuch a Degree as not to be imagined, but by thoſe who have experienced how exceedingly and ſuddenly it renovates, recruits and powerfully rengthens all the animal Faculties and generative Power in both Sexes. It inforces a bright, lively Diſpotion, baniſhes Melancholy, and inſpires Mirth and Gladneſs of Heart beyond Expreon. Abundance of Ladies, who for ſeveral Years were deemed incurably barren, have quickly, after taking it, conceived and become fruitful; and great numbers of Gentlemen, who by fa living or otherwiſe, had render’d themſelves incapable of Pro‑ creation, have ſoon been enabled by it to propagate their Species, in‑ ſomuch that many illurious Families, who for want of Children were almo inconlolable, are now blefſed with happy Ifſut, and are (under Providence) indebted to this great Medecine for their Heirs. It ree‑ tifies all Diſorders of the Stomach, creates an Appetite, procures a good Digeion, and in all weakneſs of Body, or decay of Conitu‑ tion of any kind, is a mo admirable Remedy, and even ſeems to keep back the Effes of old Age itſelf. It to be taken but a few Drops at a time, has a very fine Flavour, is pleaſant to the Palate, Cordial to the Stomach, and can be had only at the Two Blue Poſts in Haydon‑Yard in the Minories, at 5s. a Bottle, with Direions.
RUPTURES Cured by Mr. RAMSAY, Surgeon, and Man Midwife, At his Houſe in Cale‑Yard, Holbourn.

It is apprehended that the Negle of adverting for upwards of two Years, has occaoned a Report that the said Mr. RAMSAY was dead, or had declined that Branch of his Buneſs. The great Number of Perſons who labour under Misfortunes of that Nature, call for a Renewal of publick No tice, That Mr. Ramſay continues effeually to cure all Diſ‑ orders of that Kind; which was many Years ago wall at�e‑ ed by very eminent Phycians and Surgeons; and the Curi‑ ous, or Afflied may now be well ſatisfied by applying to the Publiſher of the Craftsman, and many others, of the Cer‑ tainty of Cures perform’d within later Times.

Note, To prevent any Perſon from long the Opportunity of conſulting with him, who come a great Way, he is at home, Sundays, Mondays, Tueſdays and Wedneſdays, until Twelve o’Clock. No Letters received, except Po paid.
LONDON, Printed for W. WARD, at the Black Lion in Saliſbury‑Court, Fleet‑Street; where Advertiſements, and Letters to the Author (Po paid,) are taken in.
Conterning GLEETS; and Seminal WEAKNESSES of all Kinds.

All judicious PHYSICIANS and SURGEONS allow that nothing is more difficult to cure than ubborn GLEETS and SEMINAL WEAKNESSES, whether occaon’d by too ſevare Purging for Venereal Injurice, violent Strainius, Pollutio ſui or any other Cauſe; and that they are dangerous in their Conſequences, as well as difficult to cure is as certain, nce they exceedingly weaken the Generative Faculties, inteeble the whole Nervous Syem, often bring on Heerick Heats, a Tabes Dorſalis, or Conſamption of the Back, or an Atro; by or Nervous Conſumption, which frequently ter‑ minate in Death itſelf.

All ſuch, therefore, who have the Misfortune to be troubled with Old or ubborn Gleets, Seminal Effuons, involuntary Emifons, �erffive. Nonenal Pollutions, or any Weakneſs of the Kidneys, Ureters or Bladder, the Diabetis or Incontiueney of Urine, or Diffi culty of holding their Water, would doubtleſs be glad to meet with a certain, ſafe and ſpeedy Cure, which they mo affuredly may, by taking only a ſmall Quantity of a tranſcendant BALSAMICK RE- STRICTIVE ELECTUARY, now publiſhed for a general Good after having for many Years in private Praice been experiencets never once to fail of perfely curing the mo ubborn GLEET known, in a few Days, without Difficulty or Trouble: as alſo all other Weaknefſes of the Back, Reins, Seminal Vefſels and Urinary‑ Paages, which it almo inantly cures, bringing to Rights and reoring all thoſe Parts and Pafſages to their natural Tone and priine Vigout, in a very extraordinary Manner, and by the taking a few Doſes of it only.

This tranſcendant BALSAMICK RESTRICTIVE ELECTUARY is neither diſagreeable to take, nor occasions the lea Diſorder, but is a wonderful Reorative in all Weaknees and Decay of Conitution of any Kind, and particularly ren� thens the Back, Reins, Seminal and Urinary Vefſels, to an immenſe Degree, inſomuch that in any Debility of them, one Doſe of it does more than ten of any other Re‑ medy yet found out; and all Perſons Fatigu’d with Gleets or Seminal Weakneffes of any Sort, or Weaknefſes of the Urinary Vefſels, who take it, will in three Days Time find it ſo very effeual, that they will be mo agreeably ſurpriſed at it.

When a Medicine will infallibly accompliſh ſuch a ſafe, ſpeedy, and perfe Cure of ſuch diffienlt Maladies, as Gleets and Seminal Weaknefſes are, as this Great Remedy truely and direly will, even after all other Means and Medicines have been try’d in vain; too much cannot be ſaid in praiſe of it, and this All who have ever took it for any of the above‑mentioned Purpoſes, have readily declared.

The Price of this balſamick Eleuary is but Six Shillings a Pot, altho’ for its abſolute Efficacy (one Pot alone being ſufficient in mo Caſes to accompliſh the Cure) worth ten times as much, and is to be had only at Mr. Radfors Toy‑ſhop, at the Roſe and Crown again St. Clement’s Church‑Yard in the Strand, ready ſead up with a Book of Inruions, which whomſoever reads will be a compleat Maer of his own Caſe, and perfely know when the Gleet or Weakneſs he is afflied with ſucceeds a Venereal Injury, whether all the Malignity of the Foul Diſeaſe is intirely extirpated or not.
Note, Ask only for a 6s. Pot of Balſamick Eleury.
An infallible and inant Cure for DEAFNESS, THICKNESS of HEARING, PAIN, or NOISE in the EARS, &c.
By the true, chymical, ſpecick DROPS,

Which infinitely excel all other MEDICINES ever offered to the Publick, or known in the whole World; for they di‑ rely cure Deafneſs, be it ever ſo bad, or of ever ſo long anding, and all Thickneſs of Hearing and Noiſe in the Ears, almo at once; and that after all other Means have failed, and without Trouble or the lea Uncafineſs, as many Thouſands have experienced.

They effeually remove all Pain occaoned by Cold, rengthen the Tympanum or Drum of the Ear, free the auditory Nerve from Obruion, and infallibly cure all Defes of the Hearing Faculty almo in an Inant; caung thoſe to hear exceeding quick and well, who were before in a Manner totally deaf.

Hundreds who were not able to hear a Drum when beat cloſe by them, and therefore deſpaired of being ever relieved, having been immediately and perfely cured by them to their great Joy and Admiration. — In a World, they may abſolutely be depended upon for the dire and infallible Cure of DEAFNESS, proceed‑ ing from what Cauſe ſoever. But the great Eeem and Reputation they have deſervedly gained for many Years pa, have occaoned (as uſual in ſuch Caſes) many Counterfeits to come abroad. Be‑ ware therefore of ſuch Impotions; theſe chymical and only true ſpecifick DROPS, being by the Author’s Appointment, to be � ad only at the Gentlewoman’s, at the Two Blue Pos in Ha�on Yard in the Minories, at 3s. 6d. a Bottle with Direions, and no where elſe in England.
Again the VENEREAL DISEASE.
Green Hatch Holborn
T

HE Famous Montpellier Little BOLUS, (the Bigneſs of a PEA to Take, without Smell, or Tae) Has During the Many Years it has been Pub‑ liſhed, been Experienced ſo Succeſsfull, That TWO of them in Common Venereal Inju‑ ries, And FOUR Beluffes in Worſe Caſes, Carry off a Venereal Infeion, without Telling Any One. Which is what Very Few Venereal Remedies Bedes, are Able to have ſaid of them. The Very Fir Little Bolus gives Immediate Eaſe, and Repear‑ ing it, Preſently Shews What it does, in Curing a mo Troubleſome Running, and almo Unbearable Smarting of Urine, Cordce, &c.
Price Only TWO Shillings Each,

Sealed up with Direions Ready to be Deliver’d Privately to Any Mefſenger, And to be had only In the Parlour Strait Forward Facing the Entry, At Dr. RUSSEL’s Houſe, In at the GREEN HATCH, Over Again Gray’s Inn, in HOLBORN.
Where Are Given GRATIS, The Following, viz.
The New QUAKER’s Almanack.

The New Book Of the Venereal Diemper, and a GLEET. In which, The THREE Fir Leading Symptoms of the Venereal Diemper, Viz. The Running, Heat of Urine, and Cor‑ dee, are More than Uſually, in this New Edition of this Book, Explained. — And, Perſons are Taught to Make a Little Eaſy Thing Themſelves, to Cure the Very Wor Venereal Diemper, Without Telling their Caſe to Any One.
And, The Worth, and Value, and TWENTY By‑Uſes,—Of
APENNY.
Adorned with Proper CUTS.
But the GLEET, & Venereal. DICTIONARY, is Pr. 6d.

THIS Value of (that Friend in Need) A PENNY, In Little Time, will FILL Your Purſe with Many: And, For All to Have It, who do want it Mo. ’Tis GIVEN GRATIS, and will Nothing Co But Asking For, (Their Labour Won’t be Lo} At the GREEN HATCH, Where it does Ready Lie, For ALL Who’ll Step in for’t, in PASSING BY. For Of ALL Ills, there’s None like the Direſs, (In Time of Want) of being PENNYLESS.
For the immediate Cure of BARRENNESS in WOMEN,
Tho of many Years Continuance, and proceeding from what Cauſe ſoever.—And alſo of IMPOTENCY in MEN, how‑ ever occaon’d, or of ever ſo long anding.

It. ſurprizing to ſee how ſoon this celebrated ELIXIR (even a few Doſes of it only) induces a new Train of chcarful and pleaſant Ideas, inead of thoſe deep and black Thoughts, thoſe direful Ap‑ prehenons, that ſo tenaciouſly dwelt upon the Soul, clouded the Un‑ deranding, and deroyed all Notion of ever receiving Comfort a‑ gain; for it occaons a Flow of undiurbed Spirits and cauſes bright Gleams of Joy to break in upon the Heart, and chaſe away the whole Load of depreed and melancholy Imaginations, ſo effeually, that the Patients ſeem ſuddenly relieved, as it were from Inchantment; and now enjoying free and lively Spirits, eady, ſerene and gay Thoughts, and as much amazed that they could be chain’d down to ſuch a diſmal way of Thinking, ſuch dreadful Fears, and dark In‑ combrances, as before, they were hopeleſs of ever getting free from tuhom. — In a Word, the Effe of this mo uoble ELIXIR, in ſo ſuddenly and perfely curing HYPOCHONDRIACK MELANCHO‑ LY in Men, and the HYSTERICK DISEASES, or VAPOURS in Women, even after all other Remedies have proved fruitleſs, is ino expreble, as the va Numbers of both Sexes who have been cured by it, with the utmo Satisfaion declare.

A Treatiſe of the VENE‑ REAL DISEASE, plainly diſ‑ covering and direing both Sexes how they may become their own Doors; teaching them plainly and perfely to know their own Condition and Degree of Infec‑ tion, be it what it will, from the ſlighte Gonorrhæa to the mo extreme and deplorable Degree of i�; and how to cure themſelves of any ſuch Diſorders, quickly, ſafely and ſecretly, and at a very ſmall Expence, without making their Caſe known to any, by pleaſant and agreeable Medicines, mild in their Operations, and without Confiuement or Hinderance of Buneſs; alſo to heal all Gleets proceeding From former ill Cures, Seminal Weakneſs or Genital Imbecilities.
Alſo the Co�dial Stomach Drops, which cures the Cholick, Pain in the Stomach, and all Sorts of Agues and Fevers.
Advice and Proper Remedies in all other Diſeaſes, at his Houſe aforeſa’d, where Atte. dance is given.

The Bane of Virility, or Manhood, in the one Sex, Deroyer of Fertility, or the Bearing of Children, in the others whether from ill‑cur’d Venereal Infeions (than which nothing is more common) or from inordinate Coition, or Self‑Pollution (that curſed School Wickedneſs which ſpoils all our Youth, by nipping their Manhood in the Bud) or from involuntary Emions at Night, in the Sleep, or in the Day‑time upon Stool; or with the Urine, or from Falls, Blows, Strains, Wrenches, or the like, which drain and dry up the Seminals, and witner, as it were, the Generative Facul‑ ties, caung Impotency in Men, the Flour Albus, and Barrenneſs in Women, and in the long‑run, Melancholy, Vapour, Decays of Nature and Conſumptions.

No Medicine can be more pleaſant to take, nor any Thing upon Earth more effeual for the Purpoſe; for let the Imbecility be ever ſo great, or of ever ſo long anding, and be either in the Parts, ſper‑ matick Vefſels, or Back, it certainly cures, by reviving and enrich‑ ing the Blood and Spirits, comforting, nouriſhing, and repleniſhing the Reins and Seminals, and rengthning, and reoring the Genital Parts in both Sexes, how much ſoever weakned, render’d cold, or deadned, and bringing them to their natural Force, Warmth and Vigour.
